notes: Peace in Our Hearts Mindfulness Practice Circle- This practice is inspired by the teachings and wisdom of the Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the Plum Village Tradition of Engaged Buddhism. We respect and encourage diversity and welcome you with all identities you hold. We begin with 45 minutes of sitting and walking meditation. After a short break, we will enjoy a talk, or a reading followed by group sharing (dharma sharing) about our mindfulness and meditation practice and how it influences our daily life and our interactions with the world around us. As an important part of our practice, we endeavor to create trust within our circle and hold in confidence what is shared to encourage speaking from our heart and listening to each other. We do not give advice nor engage in a debate. Dharma sharing is a practice in deep listening and loving speech. Please review the Peace in Our Hearts Sitting Group Sharing Guidelines. We acknowledge and pay gratitude to the Tilhini -Northern Chumash people on whose ancestral and unceded land we hold our practice.

name: Lotus Bud Sangha
address: 90-92 Church St, Camperdown NSW 2050
notes: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful.Each Wednesday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

notes: This friendly group in the Plum Village Tradition meets every week, as we have for some years, for mindful sitting and walking, then we read a section of one of the books by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We end by sharing insights and reflections from our practice, to water our wisdom and compassion.People can join and leave the group at any time. A more structured course can be found online, called ‘Be Calm Be Happy’. This may be particularly helpful for those new to this tradition or practice. For more details please visit: www.plumvillage.uk/learn-mindfulnessYou are very welcome to ring for a conversation before joining us to find out more; phone John Newson 0121 449 3977 or Emma 07946 451 954 john.n@phonecoop.coopMeetings are currently every Wednesday at Kings Heath Meeting House, 17 Colmore Road, B14 7PE. name: Bright Spirit Sangha

We also explore all aspects of world compassionate traditions and how engaging in mindfulness meditation can help our lives become more peaceful and calm. Our EarthZen Dumfries sangha is a small group that meets regularly together on Monday evenings on Zoom. Arrival is from 19:45 for a 20:00 start, entering  30-35 mins of silent meditation together. We walk for 5 minutes and then sit down to discuss Dharma.

The format for these days is similar but gives the opportunity to extend our practice to include outdoor walking meditation, mindful eating together and other practices such as deep relaxation.Our group and our practices are open to people of all faiths and none, experienced or new to meditation. We then have a break, after which those who wish to are invited to return for a short activity chosen by the facilitator, such as a tea meditation, a reading, or watching a Plum Village recording. We finish with a short silent meditation. On the third Thursday of the month we meet in person at a venue in Guildford town center, and once a month we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings. If you are new to meditation or Plum Village practice, we are happy to give support and guidance. name: Manchester - Heart of Manchester Sangha
address: Chorlton Unitarian Church, Wilbraham Road, Manchester, M21 9LB, United Kingdom
notes: The Heart of Manchester Sangha meets in person (not online). Our newsletter goes out monthly with more details of our meetings below. Please email heartofmanchesterstockportsanghas@outlook.com to go on the list, which does not commit you to attending. There is no fixed cost but a contribution from practitioners means we can continue to use the hall. For those who don’t carry cash or would prefer to make an online annual or monthly donation our details are as follows:The Heart of Manchester SanghaAccount Number: 41469345Sort Code: 09-01-29 All contributions are welcome.Sunday evenings (7.30–9.30 pm.) every Sunday, unless it clashes with a carol service at Christmas. The first hour or so of our practice includes guided meditation, a reading, walking meditation and silent meditation. Then an informal tea break, followed by mindful sharing – practising loving speech and deep listening.Five Mindfulness Training Meetings on the second Sunday evening of each month (7.30–9.30 pm.), reciting the trainings is woven into the shape of an evening session, as above.Monthly Saturday Morning Meetings on the second Saturday of the month we hold a session similar in form to the Sunday evenings. (10.30 am.–12.30 pm.)Days of Mindfulness three times a year, in January, May and September, we share a day in the company of one another, deepening our mindfulness practice through a range of meditations and sharing. Rough guide of programme is arrive 10.15 am. for 10.30 start, finishing at 4.00 pm. Please bring ready prepared vegetarian lunch to share. Please contact us at heartofmanchestersangha@gmail.com for more information.Solstice meetings twice a year, near to the winter and summer solstices we meet for a little longer (4.30–9.30) to enjoy a guided deep relaxation followed by an informal meal before the evening session. name: Mortock, Somerset - Dharma Bell Sangha

notes: The Dharma Bell Sangha roots itself in the Plum Village Tradition, taught by Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and his disciples. Links to the practices provided by Plum Village UK can be found here: https://plumvillage.uk/Our weekly calendar looks like this:MONDAY MORNINGS: “FROM THE HEART” 08.30Offered via Facebook Live, the “From The Heart” sessions are a time where Andy shares a brief reading from Thay’s books, starting and closing with a brief meditation. From the Heart can be accessed from this page. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/558068675090521WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING, 18.30 – 20.00Our Wednesday night Sangha Sitting is provided via Zoom. We sit and share some of Thay’s teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Dharma Bell Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting.Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there’s no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.Welcome! With a smile, Andy

name: Humanum-Values Based Mindfulness Practice
address: Północna 32/34, Pabianice, Łodzkie 95-200, Poland
notes: We are a group of HUMANUM practitioners following the path of Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We chose Thay's teachings as guidelines as we find them helpful to manage our daily lives easier and better. We call our practice Values Based Mindifuness because in our understanding mindfulness does not exist without compassion as the fundamental value. We follow the Five Mindfulness Trainings and read them regularly supporting it with recitation of other Thay writings. At the meetings we have 20 minutes of sitting meditation, 20 minutes of walking meditation and 20 minutes of lying meditation followed by Dharma sharing. We organize Humanum Mindfulness Days when we cook, eat,clean and watch Thay's lectures together and follow the 20-20-20 practice scheme twice a day. We are opened to everyone wishing to join us on the path of mindfulness practice.
